From 21: "On Friday, June 6, 2025, Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) officers carried out enforcement actions at multiple locations within Los Angeles County and the City of Los Angeles." Also mention 22: "Prior to the ICE operations, federal officials did not provide the leadership of the Los Angeles Sheriff's Department or LAPD with any notice as to the planned operations." 23: "During the course of these operations, ICE and its agents reportedly took actions that inflamed tensions and provoked protest." 24: "In all, the Department of Homeland Security reported that its enforcement activities on Friday, June 6, resulted in the arrest of approximately 44 individuals and 70-80 people detained in total." 25: "That same day, members of the public gathered in protest at the Edward R. Roybal Federal Building and U.S. Courthouse." 26: "While not unified in their views or tactics, most protesters seem to have gathered to express their opposition to the manner in which the Trump Administration has executed its immigration agenda." 27: "During the protests, Service Employees International Union California leader David Huerta was injured in the midst of interactions with federal agents." 28: "Protests continued on June 7, and June 8, 2025." 29: "Most of those involved in protesting have been exercising their rights under the First Amendment in a peaceful, non-violent manner." 30: "At no point in the past three days has there been a rebellion or an insurrection." 31: "Both LAPD and LASD have substantial training and experience responding to protests and large-scale riots." 32: "LAPD and LASD have been responding promptly, professionally, and effectively." 33: "In the afternoon of June 6, 2025, some time after protesters had gathered near the Roybal Federal Building, federal agents sent a request to LAPD for assistance." 34: "The Governor communicated unequivocally and publicly on social media that he disapproved of the federal government’s plans." 35: "On the evening of June 7, President Trump issued a memorandum entitled 'Department of Defense Security for the Protection of Department of Homeland Security Functions'." 36: "The Trump Memo does not identify the Los Angeles protests, the State, or any specific geographic region by name, but instead refers to numerous incidents of violence and disorder." 37: "The Trump Memo states: 'In light of these incidents and credible threats of continued violence...'." 38: "The Trump Memo further directs the Secretary of Defense to coordinate with the Governors of the States and the National Guard Bureau." 49: "The Governor communicated unequivocally and publicly on social media that he disapproved of the federal government’s plans." (duplicate of 34). 53: "On the evening of June 7, President Trump issued a memorandum entitled..." (duplicate). Actually 49-53 repeated earlier.

Also C: 49-53: "Early on Saturday, June 7, Border Czar Tom Homan stated..." etc. Actually C section: 49-53: "Early on Saturday, June 7, Border Czar Tom Homan stated “Mayor [Karen] Bass should be thanking us...". 50-52 included. 53: "On the evening of June 7, President Trump issued a memorandum entitled..."

Fact 2: "Prior to the ICE operations, federal officials did not provide the leadership of the Los Angeles Sheriff's Department (LASD) or Los Angeles Police Department (LAPD) with any notice as to the planned operations." (tokens 15-18). Provide snippet.

Fact 5: "That same day, members of the public gathered in protest at the Edward R. Roybal Federal Building and U.S. Courthouse." (tokens 29-33). Provide snippet.

Fact 6: "While not unified in their views or tactics, most protesters seem to have gathered to express their opposition to the manner in which the Trump Administration has executed its immigration agenda." (tokens 34-37). Provide snippet.

Fact 7: "During the protests, Service Employees International Union California leader David Huerta was injured in the midst of interactions with federal agents." (tokens 38-43). Provide snippet.

Fact 8: "Protests continued on June 7, and June 8, 2025." (tokens 44-47). Provide snippet.

Fact 9: "Most of those involved in protesting have been exercising their rights under the First Amendment in a peaceful, non-violent, and legally compliant manner." (tokens 48-52). Provide snippet.

Fact 10: "At no point in the past three days has there been a rebellion or an insurrection." (tokens 53-57). Provide snippet.

Fact 11: "Both the Los Angeles Police Department (LAPD) and Los Angeles Sheriff Department (LASD) have substantial training and experience responding to protests and large-scale riots." (tokens 61-65). Provide snippet.

Fact 12: "In the afternoon of June 6, 2025, some time after protesters had gathered near the Roybal Federal Building and its “B-18” detention facility, federal agents sent a request to LAPD for assistance." (tokens 71-78). Provide snippet.

Fact 13: "The Governor communicated unequivocally and publicly on social media that he disapproved of the federal government’s plans." (tokens 81-86). Provide snippet.

Fact 14: "On the evening of June 7, President Trump issued a memorandum entitled “Department of Defense Security for the Protection of Department of Homeland Security Functions” (the Trump Memo)." (tokens 87-93). Provide snippet.

<|channel|>analysis<|message|>We have extracted Factual_Basis_of_Case from Complaint. Need to see if any other documents contain additional factual basis facts that were not captured. The definition: "facts or evidence upon which the case is built." Likely other documents may have facts, e.g., Order, Docket, etc. But we already captured many facts from Complaint. Are there other facts in other documents? The Order contains background and procedural history, which may include facts about protests, ICE operations, etc. But those may overlap with complaint; still we might extract additional facts not in complaint: e.g., mention of "ICE operations, protests, etc." But many duplicates.

We need to ensure we have all distinct facts from all documents. The question: do we need to extract from all documents? The instruction: "Extract the checklist item from the legal case documents as completely as possible." So yes, we need to scan all documents for additional facts. We must not duplicate facts already extracted? It says "ALL distinct value of each checklist item." So duplicates should be avoided.
